meanings.definition: A word or phrase that has the same meaning as another word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: In the thesaurus, you can find an isolog for almost any word.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained that a synonym is an isolog.
meanings.sent3: The detective used the suspect's alibi as an isolog to verify his story.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an isolog for her true feelings of happiness.
meanings.sent5: Learning a new isolog can expand your vocabulary.

meanings.definition: Consisting of the same elements or parts.
meanings.sent1: The twins wore isolog outfits to the party.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle pieces were isolog and fit perfectly together.
meanings.sent3: The recipe called for isolog amounts of flour and sugar.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was isolog, with shared interests and values.
meanings.sent5: The symmetrical wings of the butterfly were isolog in shape and size.
